nodebasis

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • nodebasis.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Lifespan
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AgentMessage, RequestMessage

    public abstract class Message
extends java.lang.Object
implements Lifespan
    A Message is a means for the a node to spread or fetch information between other nodes. The class implements the Lifespan interface.
    Since:
    2016-05-19
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alexander Beliaev
    See Also:
    Lifespan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Message(int messageLife)
      Creates a Message object with the amount of lives this message should possess.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decrementLifespan()
      Decrements the current lifespan of the message by one.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Returns true if and only if this Message and the compared object refer to the same (this == other is true), or if the both Message objects share the same current lifespan and total lifespan.
      int hashCode() 
      boolean isDead()
      Returns if the message has expired.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message(int messageLife)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Creates a Message object with the amount of lives this message should possess.

        Parameters:
        messageLife - the amount of lives the message should possess.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given amount of lives are equal to or less than zero.

        Returns if the message has expired.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)

        Returns true if and only if this Message and the compared object refer to the same (this == other is true), or if the both Message objects share the same current lifespan and total lifespan.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the Object to compare to this.
        Returns:
        true if this Message and the compared object refer to the same, or if their values correspond.
